org.javaavc.platform

Interface StdIOLibrary

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.sun.jna.Library

    public interface StdIOLibrary
extends com.sun.jna.Library
    Some functions and structures, defined into stdio.h.

    Links:
    1. C file input/output -- Wikipedia.

    Author:
    Dmitriy Zavodnikov (d.zavodnikov@gmail.com)

      Closes the given file stream.

    • Method Detail

      • fopen

        StdIOLibrary.FILE fopen(java.lang.String path,
                      java.lang.String mode)
        Opens a file indicated by filename and returns a file stream associated with that file. mode is used to determine the file access mode.

        Links:
        1. fopen -- cppreference.com.

        Original signature: FILE *fopen(const char *path, const char *mode).

        Parameters:
        path - File name to associate the file stream.
        mode - NULL-terminated character string determining file access mode.
        Returns:
        Opened file stream on success, NULL on failure.

      • freopen

        StdIOLibrary.FILE freopen(java.lang.String path,
                        java.lang.String mode,
                        StdIOLibrary.FILE stream)
        Reassigns an existing file stream stream to a different file identified by filename using specified mode. mode is used to determine the new file access mode.

        Links:
        1. freopen -- cppreference.com.

        Original signature: FILE *freopen(const char *path, const char *mode, FILE *stream).

        Parameters:
        path - File name to associate the file stream.
        mode - NULL-terminated character string determining file access mode.
        stream - The file stream to modify.
        Returns:
        Opened file stream on success, NULL on failure.

      • fflush

        StdIOLibrary.FILE fflush(StdIOLibrary.FILE stream)
        Causes the output file stream to be synchronized with the actual contents of the file. If the given stream is of the input type, then the behavior of the function is undefined.

        Links:
        1. fflush -- cppreference.com.

        Original signature: int *fflush(FILE *stream).

        Parameters:
        stream - The file stream to synchronize.
        Returns:
        0​ on success, EOF otherwise.

      • fclose

        StdIOLibrary.FILE fclose(StdIOLibrary.FILE stream)
        Closes the given file stream. Any unwritten buffered data are flushed to the OS. Any unread buffered data are discarded.

        Whether or not the operation succeeds, the stream is no longer associated with a file, and the buffer allocated by setbuf or setvbuf, if any, is also disassociated and deallocated if automatic allocation was used.

        Links:
        1. fclose -- cppreference.com.

        Original signature: int *fclose(FILE *stream).

        Parameters:
        stream - The file stream to close.
        Returns:
        0​ on success, EOF otherwise.
